results.title: Silversmith
results.brief_description: The work of the silversmith is essentially that of a craftsman unassisted by modern methods of mass production. The beauty and delicacy of his hand-made creations in silver and leather make him one of the most versatile of craftsmen. This film shows the many processes involved in the creation of fine silverware, together with the tools which have been used for centuries without change.

results.title: Silver's new shine
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Look at Life”.
Today silver plays a new role in Britain. Since 1947 it has ceased to be used in British coinage and is put to work more and more widely in a variety of industries. Old silver coins are refined at the Royal Mint, to supply industry with more of this precious mineral, also used in the fine silver work for which Britain’s silversmith’s are traditionally famous.

group_siblings.title: Look at life: Bronze silver and gold

results.title: Silver
results.creator_credit: Wim Vandekeybus, Quasi Modo and Ultima Vez
results.brief_description: Ultima Vez is a dance company formed by director, choreographer, actor and photographer Wim Vandekeybus in 1985. Drawing his dance vocabulary from everyday movements, his style is high adrenaline with genuine sense of jeopardy. Vandekeybus used an Irish nursery rhyme as a basis for his performance ‘7 for a Secret never to be told’ (1997). The performance was made up of seven interflowing sections, alluding to ‘two extreme emotions, the two sexes, two precious metals and a secret’. For each scene a specific scenography and different movement material was developed. This dance video is an adaptation of the fifth scene of the performance. Music, Thierry De Mey.

results.title: Silver
results.brief_description: Footage of various facets of the silver smithing process - the production of sterling silver cutlery, engraving of silver platters, how silver is used to produce mirrors, and the importance of silver to the photographic process. Silent short produced for classroon instructional purposes.

results.title: Silk screen printing
results.creator_credit: Josef Bohmer and Harry A Kapit
results.brief_description: An introduction to silk screen printing, using ordinary paints and paper. Although the film does not deal with the use of dyes and the process of printing on fabrics, it covers adequately the more elementary uses of the process, showing the cutting of the stencil (a lacquer stencil), the removal of the top layer, fitting the stencil to the screen, and drying the finished prints - in this case Christmas and greeting cards.

results.title: Silk screen fundamentals
results.creator_credit: Durrell R. Crays and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Outlines procedures involved in constructing a ‘do-it-yourself’ stretcher frame, stretching the commercial frame, cutting paper stencils, registering the printing stock, and printing the stencils. Shos tools used in silk screen art, with emphasis on care and safety.

results.title: Silk Moth
results.brief_description: Revelas the egg-laying process of the silk moth and shows the caterpillars as they emerge from the egg. Follows the process of metamorphosis from the spinning of the cocoon to the chrysalis stage and emergence of the silk moth. No narration.

results.title: Silk dreams
results.brief_description: Tung is Vietnamese - a refugee and a teenager. He lives in the western suburbs of Sydney. The rest of his family, apart from his grandmother, are still in Vietnam. He drifts along in an alien Western environment, hanging out with a gang of young men from a similar background until his grandmother, herself disadvantaged and displaced in Australia, spurs him on to change his life. An eye-opening and realistic drama of cultural isolation in contemporary Australia.

results.title: Silicon and its compounds
results.brief_description: Presents basic chemical facts about silicon, showing its sturcture and analysing its place in the periodic table. Long used by man in making glass and in building materials, silicon compounds display a wide variety of properties which are providing an ever-increasing source of materials, sich as lubricants, paints, polishes, silicone plastics and rubber.

results.title: Silent safari: lion
results.brief_description: Shows without commentary the lion as he eats, sleeps and plays with female and cubs in his natural habitat. Also shows lions living together in prides, and hunting wild beasts such as antelope, zebra, buffalo or giraffe. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
